page.title: 16Transport in Harold Wood
page.content: Harold Wood is served by both rail and road. The A12 has a new strech of dual carriageway linking Gubbins lane to the M25. The development was planned in 1955 because of congestion and work began in February 1982, finishing in August 1984 at a cost of Â£5 million. 60,000 vehicles use the road daily Trains run from Harold Wood to London (Liverpool St.) and Southend (Essex). 3000 people travel from Harold Wood each day. Fares : Southend Return Â£3.20 adults Â£1.60 children. Liverpool St. return Â£3.80 adults Â£1.70 children 2 London Transport buses serve Harold Wood. The 296 and 247 carry 1000 passengers to Romford weekly. Each route has 61 trips each way daily (not 296 on Sunday).Fares:30p adult,15p child (flat rate). 4 Eastern National buses skirt Harold Wood(A12) 451,351, 251,151. Fares : 55p-Romf. 90p-Brent.
